messageBody:
Singh, Kanwaljit wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Is there any documentation available on how to use Test Listeners in Junit.
>
> I wanted to know more about how to exactly write test listenrs for Junit.
> (I want to trigger some events based on the output of individual test
> cases as and when the output of a test case is available).
>
> Any help will be greatly appreciated.

If you want to listen to test runs, I strongly recommend you use a
different test runner: the JUnit-addons test runner. This test runner
works the same as the JUnit text-based test runner, except that it has a
more open architecture for registering customized test listeners. The
JUnit-addons test runner is essentially a "fork" from the test runners
that JUnit provides.

http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=60272

Get the junit-addons-runner package.

Good luck.
